ACCESS_CONTROL_LEVEL.description: Defines the level at which permissions are enforced for access control. Possible values are 'class', and 'instance'.
ACCESS_CONTROL_LEVEL.help: This setting has no effect if DEFAULT_RIGHTS is set to EQ_R_ALL. 'class' is the default value (most permissive). 'instance' is the most precise (and slowest).

APP_NAME.description: Specific brand name of the application, if any.

APP_URL.deprecated: Please use BACKEND_URL and DEFAULT_APP instead.
APP_URL.description: The URL of the root folder (mapped with `./public`), with the scheme but without trailing slash (no path).

APP_LOGO_URL.description: The URL of the image to be displayed in UI as App logo in the top left corner.

APP_DEFAULT_LANG.description: The language (ISO 639-1, amongst the installed languages) that must be selected by default in the Apps for displaying multilang contents.

AUTH_SECRET_KEY.description: Secret key used for hashing JWT data.

AUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN_VALIDITY.description: Validity duration of the access token, in seconds.

AUTH_TOKEN_HTTPS.description: Flag for limiting the sending of auth token over HTTPS.

BACKEND_URL.description: The URL of the root folder (mapped with `./public`), with the scheme but without trailing slash (no path).

CIPHER_KEY.description: Private key to use for secrets decryption. This property should be defined before any encryption/decryption operation.

DB_REPLICATION.description: Strategy to apply for database replication. Possible values are: 'NO': no replication; 'MS' ('master-slave', 2 servers) write operations are performed on both servers, read operations are performed on the master only; 'MM' ('multi-master'): any number of servers; write operations are performed on all servers, read operations can be performed on any server

DB_DBMS.description: Database Management System running on the DB host. Possible values are: 'MYSQL', 'SQLSRV', 'MARIADB', 'SQLITE', 'POSTGRESQL'

DB_CHARSET.description: Charset encoding to use when manipulating strings with DBMS. The possible values depends on the DBMS.
help: MySQL: MySQL/MariaDB handles UTF8 as utf8mb3 by default ('utf8' = 'utf8mb3'). For 4-byte unicode encoding, use 'utf8mb4'.
SQLSRV: SQLSRV cluster < 2019 does not support UTF-8, so this setting is ignored.

DB_COLLATION.description: Collation to apply on SQL connection (and subsequent queries). The possible values depends on the DBMS.
help: MySQL: Possible values are 'utf8_unicode_ci' (3 bytes) or 'utf8mb4_unicode_ci' (4 bytes) in most cases.

DB_HOST.description: IP address or fully qualified domain name (ex.: sql.example.com) of the DB host.

DB_PORT.description: TCP/IP port for connecting to DB host.
help: MySQL: default port for MySQL/MariaDB is 3306
SQLSRV: default port for MS SQL Server si 1433

DB_USER.description: Login for authenticating on DB host.

DB_PASSWORD.description: Password for authenticating on DB host.

DB_NAME.description: the name of the DB that you've created or plan to use.

DEFAULT_LANG.description: The language (ISO 639-1) in which the multilang content must be provided/stored by default.
DEFAULT_LANG.help: This values impacts the way translations are stored. For a multilang application, unless specific conditions, this value should remain assigned to English ('en') in order to allow correct management of multilang values.

DEFAULT_PACKAGE.description: Package we'll try to access if nothing is specified in the url (typically while accessing root URL).

DEFAULT_APP.description: Default App to request from default package.

DEFAULT_RIGHTS.description: Rights to grant to any user when no ACL is defined.
DEFAULT_RIGHTS.help: This value is a mask that is applied when Access Controller checks the permissions. 0 means no default rights (depends on current user and related ACL); EQ_R_ALL is a mask holding all permissions.

DEBUG_LEVEL.description: Types of error to report (defaults to E_ALL = 32767, setting to 0 means no logs). Important: if logging level is set to E_ALL with all mode enabled, then the log file grows quite quickly.

DEBUG_MODE.description: Classes of report-messages to log (non-matching messages are ignored).
examples: EQ_MODE_PHP | EQ_MODE_ORM | EQ_MODE_SQL | EQ_MODE_APP | EQ_MODE_API | EQ_MODE_AAA | EQ_MODE_NET

DRAFT_ENABLED.description: Reuse draft objects (created but not saved, having status left to 'draft').

DRAFT_VALIDITY.description: Duration in days before recycling draft objects.

EMAIL_SMTP_HOST.description: Hostname of the SMTP server to use for sending emails.

EMAIL_SMTP_PORT.description: Port to use for SMTP connections.

EMAIL_SMTP_ENCRYPT.description: Encryption layer to use for SMTP connections ('tls' or 'ssl', false for SMTP with no encryption)

EMAIL_SMTP_ACCOUNT_USERNAME.description: Account name (or email address) to use to authenticate to SMTP server.

EMAIL_SMTP_ACCOUNT_PASSWORD.description: Password to use to authenticate to SMTP server.

EMAIL_SMTP_ACCOUNT_EMAIL.description: Email address to use as sender (must be allowed by SMTP server).

FILE_STORAGE_MODE.description: Storage mode for binary content. Possible values are: 'DB' (database) and 'FS' (filesystem).

HTTP_TRUSTED_HEADERS.description: Specific HTTP headers that are used to pass information from a proxy or load balancer to the backend server.
HTTP_TRUSTED_HEADERS.help: This setting must be used with caution. In particular, the X-Forwarded-For header can only be considered reliable when used in a controlled or secure environment. In other contexts (open or unsecured), it could be spoofed and should not be trusted.

HTTP_TRUSTED_PROXIES.description: Specific proxy servers or load balancers that an application or server is configured to trust when handling incoming request.

HTTP_REQUEST_TIMEOUT.description: Maximum wait time, in seconds, before cancelling a pending HTTP request. Must not exceed `max_execution_time`.

HTTP_PROCESS_USERNAME.description: Username used by the HTTP service (for rights checks).

L10N_TIMEZONE.description: Preferred timezone for controllers that generate a static output. Locale params are only relevant for data controllers involving some output impacted by localization. By convention, timezone is always set to UTC for script processing (using `date_default_timezone_set('UTC');`).

L10N_LOCALE.description: Preferred locale for controllers that generate static output. Locale params are only relevant for data controllers involving some output impacted by localization.

LOGGING_ENABLED.description: Flag for requesting to store meta data whenever an event occurs (creation, update, deletion or custom event).
LOGGING_ENABLED.help: Keep in mind that enabling logging increases I/O operations and impacts performances.

UPLOAD_MAX_FILE_SIZE.description: Maximum authorized size for file upload (in bytes). Keep in mind that this parameter does not override the PHP 'upload_max_filesize' directive, o it can be more restrictive but will not be effective if set higher.

MEM_FREE_LIMIT.description: Minimum amount of free memory (in bytes) of the system (instance) below which no new process should start.
MEM_FREE_LIMIT.help: This parameter is a threshold that eQual tries not to exceed (the task scheduler stops running tasks while free memory is below limit). However, under certain circumstances, this limit may still be momentarily surpassed. That value is complementary to the memory_limit set in php.ini (that limits the amount of memory that each PHP threads can use).

ORG_NAME.description: Name of the organisation to which belongs the instance.

ORG_URL.description: URL of the official website of the organisation.

ORM_EVENTS_FORCE_ONUPDATE_AT_CREATION.description: Flag for forcing ORM to invoke `onupdate` callbacks at object creation (i.e. when using `create()` method). This flag is for handling specific situations and should be left to false.
ORM_EVENTS_FORCE_ONUPDATE_AT_CREATION.help: When creating an object, some (or all of the) fields are assigned. This flag tells how the ORM should behave regarding the `onupdate` property of those fields, when present. By default, `onupdate` callbacks are not invoked when the assignation of the fields results from an object creation.

REST_API_URL.description: The URL specific to the API path, if any. This URL should end with a slash ('/')

ROOT_APP_URL.description: The URL of the root folder (mapped with `./public`), with the scheme but without trailing slash (no path).

TASK_EXECUTION_TIMEOUT.description: Maximum duration, in seconds, allowed for a Task to be running. Must not exceed `max_execution_time`.

USER_ACCOUNT_DISPLAYNAME.description: Strategy for displaying the user name to other users. The expected value is a string holding one or more of following references: 'id', 'nickname', 'mail', 'firstname', 'lastname', 'initials' (Note: 'mail' is the email address and suits Apps restricted to users from a same organisation but should be avoided for non public profiles).

USER_ACCOUNT_REGISTRATION.description: Flag telling if everyone is allowed to create a new user account.

USER_ACCOUNT_VALIDATION.description: Flag telling if a new user account needs to be validated before being active.
